intro: Pseudostellaria bohyeonsanensis, commonly known as the Korean starwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Korea. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are usually short and unbranched. This species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
